title: Latona

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), **Latona** is the [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [goddess](/wiki/Goddess "Goddess") for the pantheon of [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") that are not [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") or [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)").

## Description

Latona is a neutral god of holy holiness, and her [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") consist of [naiads](/wiki/Naiad "Naiad"), [oreads](/wiki/Oread "Oread"), [earth elementals](/wiki/Earth_elemental "Earth elemental"), [water elementals](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental"), and [titans](/wiki/Titan "Titan"). Her [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") gift is [The Veil of Latona](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Veil_of_Latona "DNetHack artifacts"), a neutral Ranger-favoring [intelligent artifact](/wiki/Intelligent_artifact "Intelligent artifact") whose [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [cloak of invisibility](/wiki/Cloak_of_invisibility "Cloak of invisibility"): The Veil of Latona grants [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") while carried, and grants [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") in addition to [invisibility](/wiki/Invisibility "Invisibility") while worn.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Latona](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Latona "wikipedia:Special:Search/Latona")***

Latona is the Roman equivalent of Leto, a goddess in ancient Greek mythology and religion who is the mother of [Apollo](/wiki/Apollo "Apollo") and Artemis (whose Roman equivalent is [Diana](/wiki/Diana "Diana")) - Latona is a Latinization of Leto's name, influenced by the Etruscan Letun. Leto is the daughter of the Titans Coeus and Phoebe, and the sister of Asteria. In ancient Roman art, she is presented as a modest, veiled woman in the presence of her children and Zeus, which is the basis for The Veil of Latona in dNetHack and its variants.

When Leto's beauty caught the eye of Zeus, the king of the gods, and their affair resulted in Leto becoming pregnant, Hera - queen of the gods and Zeus's ever-jealous wife - ordered all lands to shun her and deny her shelter, and sent the monstrous Python to pursue and harm Leto. The fleeing goddess eventually found the island of Delos; as it was not joined to the mainland or attached to the ocean floor, it thus did not qualify as a "land", and she gave birth there. Notably, Leto is the only one of Zeus's divine lovers to be persecuted by Hera who was a goddess herself. Leto also plays a role in other myths where she punishes mortals for their hubris against her: in one particular instance, when Niobe boasts of being a better number due to having more children, Leto asks Apollo and Artemis to avenge her, which they do by shooting all of Niobe's children dead.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Latona

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Religion in NetHack
  • priests
  • alignment
  • alignment record
  • altars
  • atheism
  • anger
  • gods
  • sacrifice
  • prayer
  • turn undead

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, Latona is the neutral goddess for the pantheon of Rangers that are not gnomish, elven or drow.

Description

Latona is a neutral god of holy holiness, and her minions consist of naiads, oreads, earth elementals, water elementals, and titans. Her crowning gift is The Veil of Latona, a neutral Ranger-favoring intelligent artifact whose base item is a cloak of invisibility: The Veil of Latona grants drain resistance while carried, and grants magic resistance and reflection in addition to invisibility while worn.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Latona

Latona is the Roman equivalent of Leto, a goddess in ancient Greek mythology and religion who is the mother of Apollo and Artemis (whose Roman equivalent is Diana) - Latona is a Latinization of Leto's name, influenced by the Etruscan Letun. Leto is the daughter of the Titans Coeus and Phoebe, and the sister of Asteria. In ancient Roman art, she is presented as a modest, veiled woman in the presence of her children and Zeus, which is the basis for The Veil of Latona in dNetHack and its variants.

When Leto's beauty caught the eye of Zeus, the king of the gods, and their affair resulted in Leto becoming pregnant, Hera - queen of the gods and Zeus's ever-jealous wife - ordered all lands to shun her and deny her shelter, and sent the monstrous Python to pursue and harm Leto. The fleeing goddess eventually found the island of Delos; as it was not joined to the mainland or attached to the ocean floor, it thus did not qualify as a "land", and she gave birth there. Notably, Leto is the only one of Zeus's divine lovers to be persecuted by Hera who was a goddess herself. Leto also plays a role in other myths where she punishes mortals for their hubris against her: in one particular instance, when Niobe boasts of being a better number due to having more children, Leto asks Apollo and Artemis to avenge her, which they do by shooting all of Niobe's children dead.

Notably, Leto is the only one of Zeus's divine lovers to be persecuted by Hera who was a goddess herself.
